stories.title: Apple’s AR/VR Headset Will Dominate WWDC–Even Though It Won’t Be There

stories.text:
Hey fellow HN people,
I have realised that the most important skill underlying a lot in tech is having good reading comprehension skills.
Right from understanding concepts in theoretical books to reading the programming docs, exceptional reading comprehension skills are useful.
What are some ways to keep improving on reading comprehension skills and taking them to next level?
Thanks.
stories.title: Increasing Reading Comprehension Skills
Software From Scratch – S1E1 – Simple Scroller (when likes 1k I will make S1E2)
Signal app downloads spike as US protesters seek message encryption (2020)

stories.text:
I've created programming language based on Ruby that simplifies creating Terminal text-based games and applications in the browser. I've released first 1.0 beta version, but I'm still adding features and fixing bugs. I yet need to add more documentation and improve Gaiman playground.

The repo for the language can be found on GitHub: https://github.com/jcubic/gaiman the only documentation so far is the Wiki with [Reference manual][1] and [examples directory][2].

And playground can be found at gaiman.js.org. There is proper tutorial on my TODO list. I've created a game for it (guess the number) that is only 31 lines of code (with empty lines), I've added it to [git][3].

You can copy paste the code into playground and play with it.

On my road map there is also node.js version, so you will be able to run your apps in the terminal.

[1]: https://github.com/jcubic/gaiman/wiki/Reference-Manual

[2]: https://github.com/jcubic/gaiman/tree/master/examples

[3]: https://github.com/jcubic/gaiman/blob/master/examples/guess_the_number.gs
stories.title: Show HN: Gaiman language for Web-based Terminal applications
